abstract.p: Dennis Dalrymple letter poses two questions about physics: what composition caused Big Bang, and is there no there there in space to which universe is expanding (S)

block.p: There are two more questions that I've unsuccessfully pondered about physics for several years that I would like to add to your list (''10 Physics Questions to Ponder for a Millennium or Two,'' Aug. 15):
1. If we are to accept the Big Bang theory on the creation of the universe, what composition of pre-existing matter caused this explosion? In other words, what was before the creation?

There are two more questions that I've unsuccessfully pondered about physics for several years that I would like to add to your list (''10 Physics Questions to Ponder for a Millennium or Two,'' Aug. 15):
1. If we are to accept the Big Bang theory on the creation of the universe, what composition of pre-existing matter caused this explosion? In other words, what was before the creation?
2. If the universe is expanding, to where is it expanding? In other words, is there no there there in the space to where the universe is expanding?
